pageContext.claim: “I hope Mike Pence comes through for us, I have to tell you. I hope that our great Vice-President, our great Vice-President comes through for us.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump offers his supporters false home when he incorrectly suggests Vice President Pence has the ability to change the election results when Congress meets two days laters to count the certified voters cast in the Electoral College. Under the law, Pence's role is more akin to the person announcing the winner of the Best Picture Oscar; he opens the envelope but has no way to change the name inside.
